GeneralInformation.Name: Workforce.Miami
GeneralInformation.Focus: Economic development initiative in Miami-Dade County
GeneralInformation.Objective: Align job training, education, and employment opportunities with the needs of growing industries
GeneralInformation.EquityFocus: Equitable access for underrepresented communities (Black, Hispanic, women)
GeneralInformation.Connections: Job seekers, employers, and community partners
GeneralInformation.Goals: Address workforce shortages and local skills gap

Mission.Commitment: Closing the skills gap in Miami-Dade County
Mission.Goals: Provide access to competitive-wage jobs, career training, tailored resources

Vision.Goal: Increase capacity of employers and workers
Vision.Aspiration: Create an inclusive and prosperous Miami-Dade County

Values.Equity: Equitable job opportunities for historically marginalized communities
Values.Collaboration: Partnerships with local government, community organizations, employers
Values.Empowerment: Support and resources for individual and business success

Resources: Commitment to address disparities in education, training, employment

Steps: Click on 'Find a job' on the homepage
Use job search filters (industry, job type)

ApprenticeshipPrograms.AdditionalInfo: Can also go to this page to find apprenticeship programs: https://dashboard.workforce.miami/opportunities and under filters, select 'Apprenticeship'

Steps: Click on 'Find a job' on the homepage
Use job search filters (industry, job type)
Login and access the Employer Dashboard
Fill out job posting details (title, description, etc.)

ApprenticeshipPrograms.Description: Customized apprenticeship programs to create a skilled talent pipeline, reducing recruitment costs and improving employee retention.
ApprenticeshipPrograms.Benefits: Aligns with operational needs, builds loyalty.

DiversityAndInclusionSupport.Description: Helps employers establish diversity commitments, set goals, and track progress.
DiversityAndInclusionSupport.Objective: Promote inclusive practices and workforce diversity.

WraparoundServices.Description: Provides support to ensure apprentices and employees succeed. Includes access to training, mentorship, and resources.

JobPostingsAndRecruitment.Description: List job opportunities on the platform to reach a diverse pool of job seekers.

InternshipPrograms.Description: Engage with internship programs to develop young talent.

WorkforceTrainingAndUpskilling.Description: Access resources to upskill current workforce, improving problem-solving and productivity.

ROIAndLongTermGrowth.Description: Supports creation of sustainable training models.
ROIAndLongTermGrowth.Benefit: For every dollar invested in apprenticeships, companies see an average return of $1.47.

JobListingsAndEmploymentOpportunities.Description: Centralized job board for exploring open positions aligned with skills and career goals.

ApprenticeshipPrograms.Description: Gain hands-on experience, training, and mentorship in structured environments.

HospitalityAndTourismIndustry.Overview: Major industry with diversity and leadership gaps.

HealthCareAndSocialAssistance.Overview: One of the largest employers with growing service demand.

IndustryBenefits.CustomizedPrograms: Each industry benefits from customized apprenticeship programs, internship opportunities, and support services to help individuals navigate career pathways effectively.

InternshipsOrApprenticeshipsWithoutColle.Overview: Opportunities available without a college degree through Workforce.Miami.

Internships.TargetAudience: High School Students and Entry-Level Job Seekers

AdvancedMatchingTechnology.VettedJobPostings: Ensures quality and relevance of opportunities

EmployerSupport.CreatingPrograms: Helps employers design inclusive apprenticeship programs

TransportationAssistance.Description: Resources for public transportation, vouchers, and commuting support for job seekers.
TransportationAssistance.Focus: Reducing employment barriers and increasing success for job seekers, particularly in apprenticeship and internship programs
TransportationAssistance.Collaborations: Local community organizations and partners for transportation support

StepsToApply: Visit the Florida Department of Economic Opportunity (DEO) website or access the CONNECT system.
Create an account by providing personal information such as Social Security Number, contact information, and employment history.
Complete the application, including the reason for separation from your last job and details of your employment history over the past 18 months.
Submit the application after reviewing the details.
EligibilityCriteria: Be unemployed through no fault of your own.
Have earned a minimum amount of wages during your base period.
Be able, available, and actively seeking work.
Meet the weekly job search requirements.

Instructions: Log in to the CONNECT system weekly to file your claim and report your job search activities.
Provide details of job search activities including employer contacts, job titles, and dates of application.
Certify for benefits by answering questions about your job search, work status, and availability for the week.
Submit your weekly claim ensuring all information is accurate before submitting.

AssistanceContact.InPersonSupport: Visit a local career center in Miami-Dade County

WorkforceMiamiServicesForDisabilities.Description: Workforce.Miami offers targeted services to help individuals with disabilities thrive in the workforce by addressing common employment barriers.

KeyServices.Name: Apprenticeship and Internship Programs
KeyServices.Description: Provides hands-on training with wages from day one, allowing individuals to gain industry-relevant experience while learning on the job.

KeyServices.Name: Wraparound Support Services
KeyServices.Description: Includes career counseling, mentorship, and job-related education to help participants overcome personal and professional challenges.

KeyServices.Name: Skills Training and Upskilling
KeyServices.Description: Offers certifications and credentials to help job seekers with disabilities stand out to employers.

KeyServices.Name: Diversity-Focused Employer Network
KeyServices.Description: Collaborates with employers committed to inclusive hiring practices to create supportive work environments that embrace diversity and accessibility.

WorkforceMiamiSupportForFormerlyIncarcer.Description: Workforce.Miami offers inclusive support services for formally incarcerated individuals, focusing on reducing employment barriers and uplifting marginalized groups.

KeyResources.Name: Apprenticeships and Opportunities Hub
KeyResources.Description: Provides details on apprenticeships, internships, and jobs with pathways designed to reduce employment barriers for marginalized groups, including the formerly incarcerated.

KeyResources.Name: Apprenticeship Program Details
KeyResources.Description: Explains registered apprenticeships that build skills through hands-on training, mentorship, and structured environments, especially for those reentering the workforce.

overview.description: Guidance and support to individuals and employers affected by natural disasters or other emergencies.

Disaster Unemployment Assistance (DUA).description: Provides temporary income support to eligible individuals, including self-employed workers who lost their jobs or had work hours reduced due to a natural disaster.
Disaster Unemployment Assistance (DUA).eligibility: Individuals must have lost employment or work hours as a direct result of a disaster and are not eligible for regular state unemployment benefits.

how_to_apply.process: Applications are processed through the Florida Department of Economic Opportunity (DEO).

Emergency Employment Programs.description: Connects affected individuals to temporary jobs in disaster response and recovery, such as clean-up, restoration, and humanitarian assistance roles.
Emergency Employment Programs.program_features: Offers immediate employment opportunities for displaced workers while supporting community recovery efforts.

Support for Businesses Affected by Disas.business_continuity_resources: Assists local businesses in accessing emergency resources like the Florida Small Business Emergency Bridge Loan Program, SBA Disaster Loans, and guidance on applying for economic injury assistance.
Support for Businesses Affected by Disas.employer_assistance: Help navigating workforce management during emergencies, including maintaining payroll, filing for employee assistance, and accessing other support services.

CareerSource South Florida â€“ Rapid Res.description: Provides rapid response services to help businesses and employees manage workforce transitions during disasters.

Florida Rebuilds â€“ Hurricane Recovery.description: Offers temporary employment for individuals affected by hurricanes and other natural disasters, including roles in construction, debris removal, and infrastructure repair.
Florida Rebuilds â€“ Hurricane Recovery.eligibility: Individuals who have lost their jobs due to the disaster or are long-term unemployed.

Miami-Dade County Emergency Management.description: Provides local resources for residents and businesses affected by disasters, including shelter information, emergency updates, and guidance on recovery programs.

Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEM.description: Offers financial assistance and services directly to individuals and businesses affected by a disaster.

disaster_preparedness_and_recovery.information_and_guidance: Provides updated information on available local, state, and federal resources during disaster events.
disaster_preparedness_and_recovery.resource_referrals: Connects individuals and businesses with community partners, non-profit organizations, and government agencies.
disaster_preparedness_and_recovery.economic_mobility_dashboard: Features specific updates and resources relevant to disaster recovery and employment services during emergencies.

emergency.use_for: Immediate emergency response for life-threatening situations or crimes in progress.

non_emergency_police_services.use_for: Non-emergency incidents such as reporting suspicious activity, minor accidents, or non-urgent situations.

national_suicide_prevention_lifeline.use_for: Suicide prevention, emotional distress, or crisis support.

thriving_mind_south_florida_crisis_helpl.use_for: Crisis support and referrals for mental health and substance abuse services.

disaster_distress_helpline_samhsa.use_for: Support for emotional distress due to disasters or traumatic events.

nami_miami_dade_county_helpline.use_for: Information and referrals for mental health resources, support groups, and advocacy.

veterans_crisis_line.use_for: Confidential crisis support for veterans and military families.

mdcps_mental_health_hotline.use_for: Mental health support for students and families in the school district.

samhsa_helpline.use_for: Information and referrals for substance use treatment.

florida_substance_abuse_hotline.use_for: Statewide support for substance abuse treatment.

florida_domestic_violence_hotline.use_for: Support and crisis intervention for victims of domestic violence.

women_in_distress_broward_county.use_for: Emergency shelter and support for victims of domestic violence.

roxcy_bolton_rape_treatment_center.use_for: Support for victims of sexual assault, including medical care and counseling.
roxcy_bolton_rape_treatment_center.website: Jackson Health â€“ Rape Treatment Center

switchboard_of_miami.use_for: Crisis counseling and information on local resources for youth and families.

child_abuse_hotline.use_for: Reporting child abuse, neglect, or endangerment.

kristi_house.use_for: Services for child victims of sexual abuse and human trafficking.

miami_dade_homeless_trust.use_for: Housing support and referrals for homeless individuals and families.

camillus_house.use_for: Emergency shelter, food assistance, and support for homelessness.

legal_services_of_greater_miami.use_for: Free legal assistance for disaster-related legal issues.

apprenticeship_miami.description: Flagship apprenticeship program for high-demand industries like technology, clean energy, hospitality, and healthcare.
apprenticeship_miami.eligibility: High school students, recent graduates, and young adults.
apprenticeship_miami.program_features: 1-3 years of paid training, industry certifications, and employment opportunities.

summer_youth_internship_program.description: Paid summer internships for high school students in partnership with key organizations.
summer_youth_internship_program.eligibility: High school students (minimum age 15) with a minimum 2.0 GPA.

youth_job_fairs_and_career_events.description: Collaborations to host youth job fairs and career events.
youth_job_fairs_and_career_events.upcoming_events: Check Workforce.Miami and CareerSource South Florida websites for announcements.

pre_apprenticeship_programs.description: Short-term training programs to prepare for full apprenticeship roles.
pre_apprenticeship_programs.program_features: Include basic skills training and industry exposure.

youth_programs.community_partnerships: Workforce.Miami partners with local schools, community organizations, and employers to offer comprehensive support.
youth_programs.how_to_get_involved: Visit the Workforce.Miami website or reach out to program coordinators for participation details.

navigate_to_registration_page.description: Look for a 'Sign Up' or 'Create Account' button on the homepage.
navigate_to_registration_page.location: Usually in the top right corner or main menu.

choose_your_account_type.job_seeker: Select if looking for job opportunities, apprenticeships, internships, or career resources.
choose_your_account_type.employer: Select if an employer looking to post job listings or access candidate resumes.

fill_out_registration_form.employer_additional_info: Company information, including business name and location.

steps_to_create_account.verify_email: Receive a verification email and click the link to verify your account.
steps_to_create_account.log_in_to_account: Return to the homepage and log in using your email and password.

set_up_profile.job_seekers: Add your resume, skills, and job preferences.
set_up_profile.employers: Set up company profile, including a company description and open job listings.

talent_pool_access.description: Employers can access resumes and profiles of job seekers via the Workforce.Miami Dashboard.

access_steps.description: Navigate to Employer Services on the homepage.
Register or log in to access the dashboard.
Access the Employer Dashboard to manage job postings and view profiles.
Use Search and Filter options to find candidates based on criteria.
Browse resumes and detailed profiles of job seekers.
Connect with candidates through messaging or by scheduling interviews.
Utilize Apprenticeship.Miami for talent development through internships and apprenticeships.
